results.title: A Fight for breath: emphysema
results.creator_credit: Floyd Elliott, ONF | NFB and Joe Licastro
results.brief_description: A film aimed at youngsters tempted by cigarettes but also for all those already addicted. Why a man suffering from emphysema has difficulty breathing is graphically illustrated. The entire respiratory system is shown in animated cross-sectional models, down to the smallest air cells, the alveoli. That is where the breakdown begins that eventually leads to impaired pulmonary function. This internal view of the damage done to the lungs is one that no viewer can ignore.

results.title: A Figgy Duff Christmas
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, ONF | NFB, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and William Gough
results.brief_description: For hundreds of years, Newfoundlanders have been celebrating Christmas, developing distinct traditions. One of these is figgy duff pudding. A musical group, named after the traditional dessert, play and sing the old songs sung at that time of the year.

results.title: A Field in Asia
results.creator_credit: George Wickremesinghe, Ceylon Government Film Unit, United Nations and Jehangir Bhownagary
results.brief_description: Agricultural extension officers of F.A.O. encourage Asian farmers to use better methods to increase harvests. An example in Ceylon shows use of better seed and improved sowing, cultivating and fertilising. Original music by Ravi Shankar.

results.title: A Few things I know about her
results.brief_description: Six short films which look at issues of femininity, body image, gender roles and which celebrate aspects of being a woman. A fascinating insight into what makes women tick.

results.title: A Few good men
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Castle Rock Entertainment, Rob Reiner, David Brown and Andrew Scheinman
results.brief_description: A young Marine is brutalised by two fellow Marines at the United States Navy Base in Cuba. The bashing ends in the young Marine’s death. It looks like a simple case but a methodical US Navy lawyer (Demi Moore) is keen to investigate the killing, convinced that the bashing was a result of a “Code Red”, an unofficial system of bastardry which aims to convert the young marines into effective fighting machines. “A Few Good Men” is a detective story, a film about responsibility and conduct, and it features some powerful and adrenalin-pumping courtroom drama. Tom Cruise is suitably boyish and charming as a maverick Navy lawyer and Jack Nicholson is outstanding as a US General arrogantly convinced of his superiority and power.

results.title: A Feeling of self worth
results.brief_description: A feeling of self worth describes the approach taken at Monterey and the positive impact this has had on the school. Present and former staff and the parents of former students talk about the school as it used to be and the improvements that have been made

results.title: A Faroe Islands family
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Films Kompagni and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the geographical features of the Faroe Islands, showing how they affect the lives of the inhabitants, making farming difficult. Highland pastures afford grazing for large flocks of sheep and a few horses and cows. The wool is plucked by hand and carded, spun and woven in the farm houses. Extensive fishing operations are a mainstay of the economy of the islands.

results.title: A Farmer's boy
results.brief_description: Film about a farmer’s son who is about to start working on his father’s farm. The boy’s parents suggest that he goes to agricultural college. Shows the work of Seale-Hayne Agricultural College, Devon including students pig feeding, milking, butter making, poultry rearing, ploughing, machine maintenance and sheep shearing.

results.title: A Farewell to arms
results.brief_description: This is the original Academy Award winning screen version of Hemingway’s well-crafted story of doomed love between Frederic, a wounded ambulance driver (Gary Cooper) and Catherine, his English nurse (Helen Hayes) in Italy in World War I. The war serves merely as a backdrop for their tragic romance. The film is mostly concerned with the fate of Catherine and Frederick - their quick but ardent meeting, their mock wedding in a hospital room, their long and painful separation during which Frederic deserts the army, and Catherine’s death in childbirth. Their farewell scene, where Catherine dies in Frederic’s arms as the bells peal out Armistice, is a moving climax to this all time classic of the screen.

results.title: A Farewell to arms
results.creator_credit: David O. Selznick, Selznick Pictures Corporation, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Charles Vidor
results.brief_description: A remake of the 1932 classic tale by famed author Ernest Hemmingway. Rock Hudson stars as an American ambulance driver during World War I. Wounded in action, he is restored to health by an army nurse played by Jennifer Jones. However, their love affair is doomed as the war hangs like a spectre over their lives. Shot on location in the Dolomite region of Italy, the film is sentimentally tragic and never quite reaches the heights of the earlier version. Vittorio De Sica is excellent as the cynical Major Rinaldi, while Hudson and Jones make an attractive couple, but their performances are hampered by a cliched script.
